DataElement.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC Edition 8 Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group based on the combination of T, N, and M categories for pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A low or intermediate grade well differentiated tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas.  According to the presence or absence of clinical syndromes that result from hormone hypersecretion, pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors are classified either as functional or nonfunctional._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A low or intermediate grade well differentiated tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas

Concepts.definition: A well differentiated, low, intermediate, or high grade neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas.  According to the presence or absence of clinical syndromes that result from hormone hypersecretion, pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors are classified either as functional or nonfunctional.

Property.preferredDefinition: Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.definition: An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5-3-19 released; tmt. 3/21/19 curated for AJCC ed. 8 content; tmt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to the staging of a pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors arising in the pancreas. Carcinomas of the pancreas, including high-grade (grade 3), poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinomas are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IV Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IV Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IV includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IV includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage III Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage III Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage III includes: (T4, N0, M0); (Any T, N1, M0). T4: Tumor invading adjacent organs (stomach, spleen, colon, adrenal gland) or the wall of large vessels (celiac axis or the superior mesenteric artery). N0: No regional lymph node involvement. N1: Regional lymph node involvement. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage III Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage III includes: (T4, N0, M0); (Any T, N1, M0). T4: Tumor invading adjacent organs (stomach, spleen, colon, adrenal gland) or the wall of large vessels (celiac axis or the superior mesenteric artery). N0: No regional lymph node involvement. N1: Regional lymph node involvement. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage II Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage II Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II includes: (T2, N0, M0); (T3, N0, M0). T2: Tumor limited to the pancreas and measuring 2-4 cm. T3: Tumor limited to the pancreas and measuring more than 4 cm; or tumor invading the duodenum or bile duct. N0: No regional lymph node involvement. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: (T2, N0, M0); (T3, N0, M0). T2: Tumor limited to the pancreas and measuring 2-4 cm. T3: Tumor limited to the pancreas and measuring more than 4 cm; or tumor invading the duodenum or bile duct. N0: No regional lymph node involvement. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage I Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage I Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage I includes: T1, N0, M0. T1: Tumor limited to the pancreas and measuring less than 2 cm. N0: No regional lymph node involvement. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage I includes: T1, N0, M0. T1: Tumor limited to the pancreas and measuring less than 2 cm. N0: No regional lymph node involvement. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

Carcinomas of the pancreas, including high-grade (grade 3), poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinomas are not staged using this staging system. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.
